text: Bo Burnham speaking at Metrograph in 2018 The Metrograph is an independent 2-screen movie theater at 7 Ludlow Street in Lower East Side, Manhattan. It opened in 2016 with two theatres, a bookstore, a "curated" concession stand, and a restaurant. It was founded by Alexander Olch, who is better known as a designer of men's ties. ==Programming== The Metrograph screens both new films, as well as revivals of older films. The schedule is programmed by Jake Perlin and Aliza Ma. It also occasionally hosts private events such as premieres of movies and TV shows. ==See also== * List of art cinemas in New York City ==References== ==External links== * ;Other art houses in Manhattan: * Sun Shine Cinema (Land Mark Theaters) * Cinema Village Category:2016 establishments in New York City Category:Cinemas and movie theaters in Manhattan Category:Repertory cinemas Category:Lower East Side
